column2: What Children's rating would best describe the young person's functioning?
column20: 70 - 61 = SOME PROBLEMS - in one area only
column21: 60 - 51 = SOME NOTICEABLE PROBLEMS - in more than one area
column22: 50 - 41 = OBVIOUS PROBLEMS - moderate impairment in most areas or severe in one area
column23: 40 - 31 = SERIOUS PROBLEMS - major impairment in several areas and unable to function in one area
column24: 30 - 21 = SEVERE PROBLEMS - unable to function in almost all situations
column25: 20 - 11 = VERY SEVERELY IMPAIRED - considerable supervision is required for safety
column26: 10 - 1 = EXTREMELY IMPAIRED - constant supervision is required for safety

column2: At what date was the Children's Global Assessment Scale rating assigned?
